Reviews.Title: “Stop over”
Reviews.Author: intime011
Reviews.Content: The hotel recognized platinum members, with a free snack, water and points. All requests were granted. Breakfast had a good selection to choose from. Waffles, hard boiled eggs, muffins, selections of breads for toast and english muffins. They also had great selections for cold cereal, granola and hot oatmeal. The cooler had milk, egg sandwiches, corn dogs, mixed fruit and grapefruit. Coffee and juice. The area for breakfast is too small, people kept getting in each others space. The room needs updated, you can tell it is off an interstate. Hotel staff, friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Zpaul
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on a trip from Missouri to Florida and I'm glad we did. Rolled in around 8:30 without a reservation and Phyllis at the front desk was very pleasant and got us a suite for a great price! Yes, the property is in the back of an abandoned parking lot, but for me it created just the right amount of separation necessary to provide for a quiet night's sleep. Our room was clean and plenty roomy enough. We didn't stick around for the breakfast, but for what we needed (comfy bed in a clean room at a fair price) it was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average - A bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: shaunbsc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Jan 2012 - booked with priceline (52 east memphis). Not a terrible place but not what I would expect from a Marriot chain. Check in was no problem, less than 2 minutes. Room was very small, even with only 1 bed. I can't imagine what a 2-bed room would look like, probably incredibly crammed. The bathroom was a decent size though. The bed was comfy and I slept well. But try to get a room on the backside of the hotel. It was confusing when I entered the parking lot - which is enormous (I think an outlet mall used to be located here and was torn down) and as you enter the parking lot you see the back side of the hotel. There wasn't a single car and I was concerned it might be closed, but as you pull around to the other side of the building you see the front - facing the interstate. There are gigantic flood lights in the parking lot in front of the building right in front of the windows. The room was actually brighter with the lights off at night. It took some crafty furniture placement to pin the drapes shut to keep most of the light out. The fitness room was a joke. Just an eliptical and a treadmill with a tv. It's about the size of a janitors closet so you can't even do any calisthenics or plyos. There was a sign posted about an option to use a nearby gym for free as a hotel guest - but I didn't have the time to go. There is also an indoor pool and hot tub which looked pretty inviting. As far as amenities go it wasn't a bad place. Breakfast was good and free, but no hot food. They have the do-it-yourself waffles that every hotel is in love with but I'm not a fan, and they also have breakfast sandwiches you can microwave. Also cereal, fruit, mini muffins, bagels, yogurt, etc. Internet was free and worked fine, and parking was free and obviously plentiful. Business center also worked as well as I needed it to. I just wasn't a fan of the hotel location. It's right off of the interstate but at an exit that doesn't seem to be really near to anything. There's some fast food places nearby but not many restaurants. Also, there's a local college right next door, and the only access to it is via the road running along the parking lot - and it is flooded in the morning with traffic. It took me about 15 minutes to get out of the parking lot, but even then due to the really fast changing light at the intersection I had to take a roundabout way and turn around to get around the light fast enough to get to work. Again, not a terrible hotel, and not many gripes about it, but I just wasn't overly impressed. I'd say you get exactly what you pay for here.

Reviews.Title: “Another place to call home...”
Reviews.Author: ARK1127
Reviews.Content: I have found another hotel in memphis that treats you like your home...The General Manager, Jacinda is absolutely wonderful and her staff is just as wonderful, in my opinion I will stay here many more times in the future. Upgrades are happening and the rooms are starting to look and feel like home. Wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Chantalfnp
Reviews.Content: Entering the hotel via a parking lot the appears abandoned set the tone. We arrived at 4:30 pm and our reserved rooms had not been "inspected" yet. The staff was very nice! Unfortunately, the hotel has a musty smell and so do the rooms. This Fairfield Inn just does not meet my expectations of Marriott properties. I won't be returning...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but works when you need a nice place to sleep for the night.”
Reviews.Author: Dylandylan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night while driving cross country. Check in staff was nice and accomodating. It stated on the website that there is a restaurant onsite, but they did not have one. Sucks cause my husband and I were driving all day and he was starving upon arrival and was really looking forward to getting a bite to eat without driving to a nearby restaurant. We ordered in instead. It's located in a street lined with other hotels/motels. Not the best location. There were hookers working the corner down the street, but not so bad you'd be afraid to walk outside. Overall rooms were clean, nice shampoo soap set, security cameras all over the perimeter making sure our moving truck filled with valuables were safe and sound. Not bad for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating Staff and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: bruin4life93
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Fairfield on a trip across our recent trip across the US. The staff was was very helpful in assisting us given our late arrival at the property. The complimentary breakfast is fine. Try to get a room on the top floor as the ceilings (and walls) are somewhat thin and can be noisy.

Reviews.Title: “NO - NO - NO !!!!”
Reviews.Author: JERSEYGREEK
Reviews.Content: This Farifield Inn at 6010 Macon Cove, Memphis, TN is without a doubt, one of the WORST Hotels I have ever stated at and I am a World traveler. The staff were INCREDIBLY RUDE, the parking lot is not lite up at night and is in a very dangerous neighbourhood. STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL AT ALL COST!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Creepy"”
Reviews.Author: TLA48
Reviews.Content: I would give this Fairfield Inn a "1" rating but the 'check in" guys were so helpful and friendly, I felt they made this place bearable. Part of the issue with this Inn is the approach to it is through what appears to be an abandoned parking lot...driving through this parking lot gives you and uneasy feeling, and you are approaching the back of the hotel (this also doesn't help). The welcome area and breakfast area in the front seemed nice enough, however the halls are dark and unwelcoming (adds to the creepy feeling)...our room was dark and there must have been a 1/2 inch of dirt under the A/C unit which made us really question how clean the rest of the room was...we couldn't sleep well because we was generally concerned about someone breaking into my car (we carried in everything visible in the car, but since we were traveling across country the trunk was full) To be fair, none the hotels on this particular exit look very appealing...the next morning we realized we had stayed in the Drury Inn on this same exit (other side of the freeway), which was a poor experience as well. Perhaps this is just a bad area overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: KathyJx
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about getting this hotel on priceline after reading some of the reviews. My husband, our nine month old son, and myself stayed two nights. The beds were comfy and all linens were crisp and clean, which is very important to me. We took advantage of the free breakfast which consisted of a variety of muffins, Activia yogurt, english muffins, a variety of cereals, and "make your own" waffles. It was a typical continental breakfast and was good for the price we paid. Price was dirt cheap by the way on priceline, less than half of what the other hotels wanted just a few exits up. The part of town was not the best, but my husband is a self defense instructor and safety fanatic and he thought it was ok. The only downside really was that the ceiling seem to be a little thin and I could occasionally hear walking on the floor above our room. Staff was great.

Reviews.Title: “The staff and the accommodations were great”
Reviews.Author: hatetotravel90
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights. The staff was excellent especially,J'cinda, and Marcus. Tonya,Unice and Rob were very helpfull also. The staff were very knowlegeable about local attractions. Where to shop, eat. They gave very good directions and printouts on how to get from one attraction to another. They staff went beyond the usual customer friendly smile. They made our visit to Memphis truly memorable. The room was nice , clean and comfortable. We would definely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Fairfield.....”
Reviews.Author: e3ward
Reviews.Content: Room was fine, no complaints there. We had major issues with people stomping around upstairs and a group of kids that ran up and down the halls all night long. Nothing was ever done about them. Area around the hotel isn't that great. I had a very uneasy feeling the whole time. Hotel was easy to find, a few decent places to eat nearby. Hotel did have free wi-fi that was good. While we had no overall problems with our actual room or the staff itself, I probably wouldn't stay here again, just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value thanks to Priceline bid, but some issues...”
Reviews.Author: txgmc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Fairfield Inn while on the road from Texas to New England. I used the priceline.com name your price feature and won a bid that was about $20 per night less than the lowest internet price. Because of the low price, I consider my stay to have been OK; otherwise, I would not have been as happy. The location is good - right off I-40 at Sycamore View - with plenty of free parking. The hotel itself is nice enough, with a big indoor pool, basic public areas, and updated guest rooms. My room, which was a one king bed setup, was spacious and comfortable. The bed was comfortable as usual for Fairfield Inns, and everything in the room worked well. I found it interesting that even though the parking lot was half empty (most likely indicating that it was not a fully booked night), the pool was overflowing with kids - and I mean dozens upon dozens of them running through the lobby and all. Despite the nice facility, I was not able to get to sleep until 3AM because there was a party going on in the room across the hall. There must have been 25 people in that room, with music, loud talking in the corridor, and people constantly going in and out slamming the door. I [generously] gave them until midnight to quiet down and then called the front desk, as I needed to be well-rested for an 8 hour drive the following day. The clerk did not seem the least bit motivated to tell the partiers to quiet down despite me asking him to do so. Instead, he offered to move me to another room, which really wasn't an issue as it was midnight and I was leaving at 6am. I just wnted to get some sleep. I can see people having a party until a reasonable hour, but talking in the halls and slamming doors until 3AM is totally inconsiderate and unacceptable for the hotel staff to turn their head to it going on. Every time I asked him to please have the partiers quiet down, he had some other idea for me. It seemed as if he was avoiding the problem at hand. Upon check out I was given a $25 Marriott gift certificate due to the inconvenience. I have no idea why the hotel clerk would not just ask the partiers to quiet down. I'd have much rather got a decent night sleep as opposed to a $25 coupon. Because of this incident, I would not balk if assigned to this Fairfield with a piceline.com bid, but I would never choose this hotel over the dozens of other similarly-priced Memphis hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Basic But Overall Clean”
Reviews.Author: LSULA
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel lobby is very small and not many table for breakfast. Breakfast area is one of the smallest I have ever been in. However, the choices were normal and good. Stayed in a King room. The room was Very small and basic. Sheets were a little rough. Overall the hotel was clean yet simple. Quick one night stay...this is the place. More than one night....Maybe look into another option. Pricing was under $100 which is the max. I would pay for that area and this particular hotel. But Again....Very Friendly Staff and Serves the one night business trip purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great room. Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Shishkabob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is your basic Fairfield Inn, but that's the joy of this brand. You know what you're getting and it doesn't disappoint. Great service and attentive staff. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service and a great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: imthewanderer
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at this hotel on a trip to Memphis and both times it has been a perfect fit for us. I don't like to pay the super high prices to stay downtown and this hotel was 1/2 the downtown hotels. The pool and whirlpool are maintained and wonderful. As for breakfast, they keep it clean and tidy, even clearing your table while you read the paper after breakfast. The staff is so friendly. They make good recommendations about local attractions. We don't mind the drive into Memphis because the hotel is so nice. It's a bit out of the way, but not a problem. My son stayed in a 4 star hotel downtown several years ago and it wasn't anything as nice as this, but it was double the price. For less than $90 per night, we stayed in a spacious suite. I'd rather save my money for museums and Beale Street than to spend it on a high-priced downtown hotel. When we go in the future for a weekend getaway, I'll be back. I won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It Served Its Purpose”
Reviews.Author: shannon50
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were on our way from Dallas to Nashville and made a pit stop in Memphis to get some rest. The room was clean and good for your basic needs. The room was small and the bed was fairly comfortable. The breakfast area was small but served its purpose and the food was your typical continental breakfast food. Overall I might stay there again if the price were right but I think for $99 a night you can find something a little bit better. I would suggest you try to get a room on the side of the building not facing the freeway it made it a little loud in the room.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but apparently no true suites”
Reviews.Author: coloradocarol
Reviews.Content: In spite of the name, Fairfield Inn & "Suites", there are apparently no true suites. We booked on the Marriott web site and selected accommodations described as a "studio suite". A floor-to-ceiling closet partially separated the bedroom from the 2nd room, but the rest of the space between the rooms was open. This is fine for a single traveler or couple who gets up at the same time. But, if one person gets up before the other, it is hard to keep from disturbing the person trying to sleep. The living room area had a small sofa bed (loveseat sized) as well as desk and plenty of lighting. Built-ins for the TV and behind the couch made the room look like it was set on an angle and was esthetically interesting. However, it was an inefficient use of space. The desk and chair were cramed against the loveseat. There was no room for a recliner or easy chair & ottoman. The decor was updated (apparently in 2006), there were a micro & fridge (but no freezer compartment). The bed was comfortable. There were plenty of drawers and spacious closet. The bathroom needed updating but was adequate. Everythng was clean. The single heating/AC unit was especially quiet -- no loud fan or uncomfortable blowing. (The open arrangement --studio rather than true suite -- allows them to get by with one heating/AC unit for both areas.) We requested a room on the back side, away from I-40. Our room/studio was quiet. The internet connection was easy to make and never dropped but somewhat slow. Breakfast was as described on the Marriott web site -- plenty adequate but not special. There was a small pool and spa. There were cookies in the evening in the lobby. BEST thing was the staff. All were SUPER NICE. I would have rated this higher except for the disappointment of getting a studio, not a true suite. Perhaps this was my fault for not reading more closely or asking questions before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the basics”
Reviews.Author: 2wheeltourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 2 nights and honestly I booked this hotel by mistake thinking I was booking the regular Marriot just next door. The rooms are fairly basic and the AC a little on the noisy side. None the less this hotel was sharply clean and well maintained. The desk staff and buffet staff were as friendly as family. Good selection of channels on the TV and the internet is free. So after staying here I can safely say that, I would not choose it for a vacation hotel. But as a base room or while in town on business this place has all you need and holds to budget.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JaneEyre90
Reviews.Content: VERY friendly staff, lemonade and cookies at check in. People falling all over us to get a luggage cart, directions, etc. A great hotel off the highway. A little deceiving when you drive in...it looks like an abandoned parking lot. You just have to go around the backside to get the front entrance. I was told the "back" parking lot belongs to the abandoned go-kart track next door. Reliable internet in the lobby, very clean pool, great rooms and bedding. I just wish there was a fridge in the room...my only complaint. A huge shopping mall nearby, plenty of restaurants too. Morning breakfast includes waffles if you want, and very friendly, chatty staff. Lots of southern hospitality here!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: angeloforange
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed our first night at the REd roof inn (I do not recommend staying there) the next day we called around looking for better accomidations and we found them in this hotel. My cousin brought 4 kids and I brought my son and three two year olds and two one year olds are anything but quiet the staff there was wonderful and helpful. The pool was lots of fun. The rooms where clean, the showers where twice as large as the red roof inns, AND THE ROOMS WHERE CLEAN!!!! We didnt watch the tv at this hotel cause we spent most of our time in the pool :) The breakfast was so good. they had bagels fruit waffles cereal oatmeal. The bed where so sooooooooooo soft and comfortable. the excercise room was small but it was peaceful. My cousin and her freind becky went down and worked out for a couple of minutes then they hopped into the hot tub and then the pool while my uncle watched their kids. I strognly recommend this hotel if you are ever in memphis.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Henry_Jones_Jr
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a simplistic, affordable hotel in Memphis for a weekend retreat from our hometown and this one fit the bill. After reading the reviews, I was impressed that this location would be a solid choice. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very helpful person at the front desk. After asking what type of room (king), floor (third) and location (back side, away from the interstate - yes, you do want to stay on the back side) we wanted, he proceeded to try and honor those requests. After finding that the only kings he had third floor/back were king suites, he immediately proceeded to upgrade us to a suite at no additional charge over that of the regular king rate...a great start to our weekend. But that wasn't the end. We found everything to be in great shape, very clean. The wireless internet service worked perfectly. And every member of the staff seemed very friendly - heard "have a nice day" each morning as we exited the free continental breakfast and the hotel. It has very convenient to access both downtown Memphis (via I-40 West) and the major shopping areas on the northeast side as well. Bottom line - we were very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean, convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend trip with family. We needed three adjoining rooms (children in party) which they would not guarantee when we booked the rooms, but I found out that this is standard (if irritating) with virtually all chains. At check-in they were very accommodating and we got the rooms we needed. My family (two adults, two kids) had a suite which was great--plenty of room, clean and reasonable privacy. My in-laws had one double-double room and one king room and I thought they seemed a little cramped. For $10-20 more go for the suite! Amenities: Good a/c, it was a little iffy on maintaining a constant temperature, but was not noisy. Towels were too small, and rough and not very absorbent. Indoor pool was small but great for kids--pool area was very clean and always well-equipped with towels. Breakfast was fine: the usual waffles, yogurt, bagels, etc. They actually had protein which was a plus and very good coffee. Location is very convenient to 40 and Sam Cooper. About 10-12 minutes to Beale St. area on Sam Cooper. The area was a little rundown in parts, but I did not feel unsafe. I like being downtown but you get more for your money here.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy location, though a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: tanalexs
Reviews.Content: September 3, 2007 stay: This Fairfield Inn was the least expensive when I checked in with the prepaid option. Though its location is a little off, I thought it was cozy and effective. It is located at the end of the stretch with several other hotels/motels on the low to mid range, and getting on/off the expressway was easy. The property looked and felt spotlessly clean. Bedding and amenities were good. Although I did not use the pool, it looked well maintained. The front desk was outstanding, and performed at its best all the time I was there. Wireless internet was available, but was a little slow. Nothing much to eat in the immediate surrounding except for fast food (Tops BBQ stood out!) Driving to the other side of the expressway however opened up significant eating opportunities. Only suggestion, try to get a room facing opposite the expressway. Though well sound insulated, you can still hear the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: marbletree
Reviews.Content: Very good bed and linens in the king room. Make sure you request a room on the SOUTH side of the building. The north side is very close to I-40. There are several restaurants nearby for breakfast; Waffle House, Cracker Barrel, etc. Gas stations, too. Only negatives -- The parking lot is mostly on the back, north side. It is dark and confined, so park near or under a light. Staff was a little tunnel visioned both at evening check in and morning check out. At both times I helped other guests who needed assistance (doors, dropped food) while the only visible staff person had his head in the computer. The lady picking up in the breakfast area in the morning didn't say a word or give a smile to any of the dozen or so guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Spend the Night”
Reviews.Author: mamie222
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and well kept. Comfortable beds. Staff is friendly and helpful. Nice pool and hot tub area. Exactly what you would expect from a Fairfield.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trektravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was friendly. The pool was well heated, rooms were clean, beds were typical, breakfast was fresh. Only complaint was the shower could have been a bit warmer. All else was great!

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Memphis
HotelInfo.Address: 6010 Macon Cove Road, Memphis, TN 38134
